title: Lemon Curd

ingredients.content: 1 lemon, thin peelings of skin and juice (approx. 40 g)

preparations.content: Place sugar and lemon peel in mixing bowl then grind <b>20 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add eggs, butter and lemon juice then mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides and lid of mixing bowl with spatula then cook <b>4 min/80°C/speed 4<b>. Check curd has thickened - if not, prolong cooking time by 1-2 minutes. Transfer to warm sterilised jars, seal, label and allow to cool before placing in fridge. Serve chilled.

hintsAndTricks: The curd will set firmer as it cools.
Easily doubled (cook 7 minutes) or tripled (cook 10 minutes) in step 2.
Will keep for up to one week in the fridge after opening.
Try using with other citrus fruits such as orange or grapefruit.

Lemon curd is so versatile, and can be used in everything from all sorts of pastries, lemon meringue pie, as a filling for sponge cakes, as a quick dessert with fruit and yoghurt, or simply as a preserve on toast. It is quick and easy to make your own at home, and it tastes so much better than the shop-bought variety.
